In this article
Looking to nail down your next holy grail moisturizer or revamp your glam for glowing makeup looks this summer? More often than not, Amazon is the answer. This e-tailer, after all, delivers big with best-in-class beauty products that will arrive at your door faster than the speed of light.
In recent years, Amazon has become a shopping destination to find top beauty brands, whether it’s newly popular beauty products on TikTok, cult-favorite E.l.f. beauty products, or a long-time medicine cabinet staple like Cerave face wash. But budget-friendly beauty buys aren’t the only products available at Amazon: The retailer has recently expanded its luxury beauty section where you shop the best beauty products from Clinique, Oribe, Augustinus Bader, and more, all with the convenience of Prime shipping.
Another major benefit of shopping for affordable and quick-shipping beauty products on Amazon is that you have access to year-round flash discounts. Through April 30, the retailer is offering 20 percent off deals on Amazon’s Haul Storefront — which is already packed with affordable essentials. If you’re looking to nail your beauty budget all throughout the year, make sure to keep tabs on Amazon’s daily deals.

Top Amazon Beauty Products of 2025
- Clean Skin Club Clean Towels
- Crest 3D Whitestrips Teeth Whitening Kit
- Sacheu Lip Liner Stay-n Peel Off Lip Stain
- Maybelline Lash Sensational Sky High Washable Mascara
- Lancôme Lip Idôle Squalane-12 Butterglow Hydrating Lip Balm
- EltaMD UV Daily Broad Spectrum Sunscreen
- CosRx Snail Mucin 96% Power Repairing Essence
- Nooni Appleberry Lip Oil
- Samnyte Hair Wax Stick
To put you in the mood for some seasonal Amazon shopping, we’ve rounded up the top beauty products currently available on their site — from the best anti-aging serums to all kinds of hair styling tools, travel makeup bags, affordable essentials like shampoo and conditioner, and everything in between. WWD Shop editors compiled this comprehensive guide with in-house product testing and thorough research: crucial components that go into all of our product coverage. And, of course, we also made sure to devote time towards spotlighting celebrity-adored products that have helped them (and can help you!) become red carpet–ready in no time.
Editor’s Choice: Top 10 Amazon Beauty Products of 2025, Tested & Reviewed
Out of the thousands of Amazon beauty products to add to your cart, some stand out for their glowing customer reviews, TikTok-viral popularity, and superlative rankings on bestseller lists. These top 10 picks include the items that wowed our panel of testers and WWD Shop editors across multiple skin types, hair textures, and glam goals. Below, you’ll find our beauty regimen holy grails and true recommendations for shopping skin care, hair care, makeup, and beyond from Amazon.
Clean Skin Club Clean Towels
These towelettes easily remove lipsticks and foundations when wet, and soak up water when you need to dry your skin. They’re great for use at home or when traveling — and are far more sanitary than reusing damp wash cloths that have been stored in a dark bathroom. The disposable towels have a soft texture, but don’t let that fool you — each one is durable and highly absorbent.
Editor testing and review notes: “If I’m traveling, I always pack a handful of these towelettes in my purse. I feel better using these over hotel towels, and if I’m staying with friends, I don’t have to worry about staining their wash cloths with my makeup. They’re soft on the skin and give me a little exfoliation, too.” — Sullivan
Price upon publish date of this article: $17.05
Crest 3D Whitestrips Teeth Whitening Kit
This product is so highly praised and universally loved that it needs no introduction: When you want your pearly whites to shine, there’s no better choice than Crest 3D Whitestrips. The strips brighten your teeth while lifting stains from common culprits like red wine, coffee, and berries.
Editor testing and review notes: “My teeth are highly sensitive, and Crest’s white strips are a rarity in that they deliver the brightening results I want without causing pain when I sip an icy drink the next day.” — Sullivan
Price upon publish date of this article: $44.95
Lancôme Lip Idôle Squalane-12 Butterglow Hydrating Lip Balm
For soft, hydrated lips with a touch of natural shine, Lip Idôle Squalane 12 Butterglow Hydrating Lip Balm is a must-have. The tinted lip balm is infused with squalane and rich butters that work together to nourish and hydrate, giving lips a smooth, plump appearance. Perfect for daily use, this balm — which is prone to selling out in popular shades — keeps lips feeling comfortable and looking naturally glossy all day long.
Editor testing and review notes: “Lancôme’s Lip Idôle Squalane-12 Butterglow Hydrating Lip Balm in shade 10 Keep It Glowy delivers what I think of as the ‘no-lipstick lipstick’ look. That buttery, hydrating feel is delivered immediately upon application, while the buildable pink hue really allows the wearer to decide how pink they want their pout to look. In my testing experience, a few swipes of this top product made my lips look naturally flushed with a pinch of pink that revitalizes and amplifies the appearance of one’s lips. That level of pigment control while also delivering long-lasting hydration is a rarity in lip color products, in my experience.” — WWD Director of Commerce Adam Mansuroglu
Price upon publish date of this article: $24
Sacheu Lip Liner Stay-n Peel Off Lip Stain
Popularized on TikTok courtesy of creators like Alix Earle, Sacheu’s lip stain is a shortcut for fuller-looking lips that won’t smudge or transfer all night long. Simply exfoliate your lips, trace the product around the perimeter of your smile, then wait 10 minutes as it sets. Then peel off the top layer of product (it lifts easily) to reveal a wash of color that stays put for hours on end.
Editor testing and review notes: “I’ve tried a handful of peel-off lip stains, and this one gives me the best results by far. You have to dunk the wand into the tube a few times to get enough product to fully line your lips, but the formula applies and fades super evenly. And most importantly, it doesn’t budge, making it a great option for busy days at work or long nights out. The Muah-ve shade is a perfect neutral with plum undertones — I love how it wears under a coat of lip gloss of lip oil. — Sullivan
Price upon publish date of this article: $12
Maybelline Lash Sensational Sky High Washable Mascara
Over 80,000 five-star reviewers on Amazon sing the praises of this Maybelline mascara for its lightweight-yet-thickening formula, as well as the wand’s ability to layer on coats without resulting in clumps. We also unanimously agree on the mascaras super washable formula that leaves no panda eyes or stained residue behind. However, you’ll notice that your bare lashes are softer than they started, thanks to conditioning bamboo extract that supports long-term lash health.
Editor testing and review notes: “This mascara is particularly impressive for its super flexible wand. I love that the bristles taper at the end, because it allows me to comb each lash for clean, clump-free volume. The formula leans on the wet side, which makes it ideal for building impressive length, while the bamboo extract makes it wear comfortably on the eye throughout the day — no brittle lashes here. It’s also impressively easy to wash away with a simple makeup remover or micellar water.” — Former WWD Shop writer Olivia Cigliano
Price upon publish date of this article: $8.32
EltaMD UV Daily Broad Spectrum Sunscreen
Even on cloudy days, UVA and UVB rays pose a danger to our skin and can cause irreversible damage if not protected against. The trick for everyday SPF usage is to find a sunscreen you actually enjoy putting on, and any EltaMD formula is delightful. But this UV Daily is especially convenient as it provides both serious hydration (boosted with hyaluronic acid) and broad-spectrum UV protection. This face sunscreen-meets-moisturizer has over 15,000 reviews, which is incredible for the oft-overlooked category of sun protection.
Editor testing and review notes: “This is a daily staple in my skin care routine and I never leave the house without slathering it all over my face, neck and tops of my hands.” — Sullivan
What testers say: “I have been using Elta MD sunscreen for several years. (I prefer the non-tinted, as the tinted can leave a stain inside my sun hats). This sunscreen has all the protection of zinc oxide along with UVA/UVB protection. It leaves my skin with a soft texture and no tell-tale white that might otherwise be the case with zinc oxide. This is transparent zinc oxide. Recently, I asked my dermatologist about it, as I saw he had a display for Elta in his office. He said it’s ‘the best sunscreen on earth.'”
Price upon publish date of this article: $35
CosRx Snail Mucin 96% Power Repairing Essence
CosRx’s snail mucin serum is an Amazon all-star, clinching the number one best-selling spot across all of Amazon’s facial serums. The cooling gel essence features a high concentration of snail mucin, an ingredient that delivers hydration on contact, and shows promise for smoothing fine lines and soothing redness when used consistently. One WWD Shop editor tried it out — read our CosRx snail mucin essence testing review for all the details.
Editor testing and review notes: “CosRx snail mucin essence feels like a lightweight gel on your skin, and dries down to a dewy finish that made my complexion look hydrated and feel silky. After two weeks of testing, I’ve noticed less redness and a subtle plumping effect that’s smoothed fine lines, particularly on my forehead.” — Sullivan
What testers say: “I absolutely swear by this product. I’ve recommended snail mucin to my mom and grandma and they’ve both bought it and absolutely love it. It’s super hydrating, light, and leaves your skin glowing and feeling amazing. I have super sensitive skin so I was hesitant about buying it, but I read the reviews and I do have to say that this stuff actually works.”
Price upon publish date of this article: $18.95
Nooni Appleberry Lip Oil
Nooni’s Appleseed Lip Oil stains the lips with a watercolor-like tint while delivering lightweight hydration. That — combined with its under-$15 price point — has earned it hundreds of thousands of views on TikTok and over 11,000 five-star reviews on Amazon. We recommend the Appleberry shade, which reads as a cool pink.
Editor testing and review notes:“I was blown away by the quality of this lip oil, given its price. It’s intensely pigmented, so you only need one coat to tint your lips — and it leaves behind a gorgeous stain when it fades. I find that it gives me about an hour of moisture; after that, I follow up with a lip balm as needed, since the stain stays put for about four hours. Just note that the proportions of the product are small, including both the amount of product in the tube as well as the size of the wand. ” — Sullivan
Price upon publish date of this article: $12
Samnyte Hair Wax Stick
The Samnyte Hair Wax Stick is your ticket to snatched and sleek hair styling, and it comes recommended by model Josephine Skriver. Take it from over 30,000 five-star Amazon reviews that deem it the best product to tame flyaways and slick updos without leaving sticky or crunchy residue.
Editor testing and review notes: “When I first dabbled in the slicked-back ponytail look, this stick was my training wheels — it’s mess-free to apply and practically glues down the flyaways my naturally curly hair gets around my temples. And even after trying pomades and oils that go for $30 or more, I still find myself coming back to this budget-friendly stick. It doesn’t leave white specks in its wake and ensures my hair won’t budge, even in gusty weather.” — Sullivan
What testers say: “I have the peskiest baby hairs and I hadn’t found a product that worked. I had tried something else that was more like a gel, but it made my hairs super hard. This is almost perfect. You can tell that its effectiveness fades over the course of the day, but I’ll take what I can get.”
Price upon publish date of this article: $7.99
Top Skin Care Products on Amazon
Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask
#3 Amazon Bestseller in Lip Balms & Moisturizers
The gold standard of leave-on lip masks, this Laneige treatment delivers intense moisture and antioxidants while you sleep (or any time of the day) through the collaboration of ingredients like berry fruit complex, murumuru seed, and shea butter. The intensive-care mask can be a savior for chronically dehydrated lips and is especially helpful as an eleventh-hour cure before a big, glamorous function. You don’t need your horoscope to tell you that oh-so-soft pouts are in your near future.
Editor testing and review notes: One editor on the WWD Shop team uses this beauty product ever single night for his dry, chapped lips and has seen a noticeable difference when he wakes up in the morning.
Price upon publish date of this article: $24
L’Oréal Paris Revitalift 3% Retinol Serum
Believe it or not, you can achieve all your anti-aging skin goals without shelling out the big bucks. WWD Shop Editors point to the L’Oréal Paris Revitalift 3% Retinol Serum as proof, as its formula deposits potent retinol, teamed with nourishing vitamin E and hyaluronic acid, with impressive fine line-smoothing results. After consistent testing, we found this top anti-aging serum delivers on fading discoloration too, and visibly improves the appearance of pores and overall skin elasticity.
Editor testing and review notes: “The first thing I do when I’m trying a new product is review the product’s ingredient list. L’Oréal’s retinol serum passed my inspection with flying colors, courtesy of a hefty dose of retinol — a proven anti-aging ingredient — as well as vitamin E and hyaluronic acid, which in my experience, help to reduce any irritation I feel from using a retinol product. It feels lightweight but hydrating on my skin, which is a winning combination in my evening skin care routine.” — Sullivan
What testers say: “My skin texture feels smoother, softer. I’ve been using this product over six months and plan to continue. The overall appearance of my skin has improved including fine lines and wrinkles. I like the silky texture of this serum. So happy with the results.”
Price upon publish date of this article: $31.68
Augustinus Bader The Eye Patches
Besides flaunting enviable hair during the 2025 Grammy Awards, Charli XCX (who was nominated a total of eight times and took home three trophies) also had flawless skin — all because of The Method by Augustinus Bader, a carefully curated and multi-step routine featuring the TikTok-viral brand’s bestsellers. One of these is Augustinus Bader’s The Eye Patches, which were applied to Charli XCX’s under-eye area to help brighten it, reduce puffiness, and lock in moisture. These patches also work to reduce the appearance of wrinkles and other signs of aging, as well as to calm redness and irritation. In other words, they’re multitalented legends and are bound to transform an area of your face that’s, alas, often neglected in favor of other priorities. PS: We included the eye patches on our roundup of the best under-eye masks of 2025. They’re just that good.
Editor testing and review notes: “These eye patches are exactly what you’d expect from Augustinus Bader: They’re carefully packaged in individual saucers with plenty of serum, they feel lightweight and cooling on the skin, and you’ll actually notice a difference when you use them regularly. To get the most bang for my buck, I usually leave them on for a full hour. When I peel them off, my eyes look brighter and way more hydrated.” — Senior Beauty and Lifestyle Commerce Editor Claire Sullivan
Price upon publish date of this article: $130
Shani Darden Skin Care Triple Acid Signature Peel
A big list of celebrities — think Jessica Alba, Shay Mitchell, and Kelly Rowland — can thank Hollywood esthetician Shani Darden for their glowing red carpet complexions. Now, she’s made her facials accessible to those who can perhaps only experience award show season on the big screen, with none other than the Triple Acid Signature Peel. It’s a two-step regimen that rids skin of dead cells through the powers of, you guessed it, a trio of acids. In addition, kaolin clay and bentonite clay rid pores of dirt, thereby yielding photogenic radiance. PS: Acne-prone skin will be especially enamored by this Amazon beauty buy.
Editor testing and review notes: “You should see my skin after I’ve used this face mask: It’s positively glowing. You can feel it working when you apply the first step, then after one minute, a little more intense tingling as you massage on the Kaolin clay mask. I’ll let that sit for 10 minutes, then rinse it off with warm water. My skin always gets a nice flush after I use this mask (not so red that I’m worried about irritation), so I’ll usually follow up with a cooling serum or ice roller for a full at-home spa experience. But the best part is when I wake up the following morning — my pores look tighter, there’s nary a blackhead in sight, and my skin feels and looks impossibly smooth.” — Sullivan
Price upon publish date of this article: $125
SkinMedica TNS Serum
This is the serum for you if you’re struggling with fine lines, wrinkles, or dark spots — imperfections every red carpet attendee knows need to be concealed to the max. SkinMedica’s serum contains natural growth factors that help skin cells regenerate rapidly while promoting elasticity and firmness. It’s also good for all skin types and is a gentle formula that works for you, never against you. You heard it here first: Healthy skin is this season’s hottest accessory.
Editor testing and review notes: “I love a good face serum, but this one has to be one of my top favorites. Is it the cheapest option on the market? No, but it’s one of the most effective — you get what you pay for. SkinMedica, take all my money!” — Mansuroglu
Price upon publish date of this article: $280.25
Mighty Patch The Original Pimple Patch
Waking up with a pimple is like heading to the beach and a thunderstorm rolls through — zits have a way of ruining your day. Need a quick fix? The best pimple patches absorb excess oils, decrease the look of your breakouts, and most importantly, don’t slide off your face. Mighty Patch’s The Original acne patches stay right where you place them, decreasing inflammation and expediting your pimple’s healing process.
Editor testing and review notes: “Mighty Patch Original patches have duct tape-caliber sticking power. I have dry skin, so I’m always layering on face serums and moisturizers before bed — these stickers stay put, even on top of those skin care products. They’re peerless for purging whiteheads.” — Sullivan
What testers say: “If this product could talk, it would quickly tell Dr.Pimple Popper to ‘hold my beer’ This product is like no other, working quickly to help get rid of the pesky little zits that always pop up at the worst time possible. Wash your face, apply a patch, go to bed and it will be all but gone by morning. My 40 year old self could only have dreamt of something like this back in my teenage years!”
Price upon publish date of this article: $12.99
Embyrolisse Lait-Crème Concentré
This iconic French face cream is a staple in makeup artists’ kits for pre-glam skin prep. The lotion, which contains just a few key ingredients like shea butter and aloe, acts like a makeup primer by smoothing out skin and delivering just a touch of tackiness that grabs onto any foundation you apply on top. Because of its simple formula, you can also use it as a hand lotion, body cream, and to smooth out split ends on frazzled hair.
Editor testing and review notes: “What’s most impressive about Embryolisse Lait-Crème Concentré is the hydration it delivers despite its lightweight feel. It’s this combination that makes it an excellent base for makeup on any skin type: Oily types won’t have to worry about excess grease and dry types won’t need to layer on hydrating serums underneath the cream for smooth makeup application. But it does so much more than prime the skin for makeup: I also use it as a body lotion, hand cream, leave-in conditioner, and even a makeup remover.” — Sullivan
What testers say: “The Embryolisse Lait-Crème Concentré is a skincare game-changer! This versatile face cream and makeup primer has quickly become a staple in my routine. It’s like a magic potion that hydrates, smooths, and preps my skin all in one go. The texture is rich yet lightweight, absorbing beautifully into the skin without leaving any greasiness. It provides a perfect base for makeup, creating a smooth canvas that makes foundation glide on effortlessly and stay put throughout the day. Plus, it adds a subtle glow that makes my skin look naturally radiant.”
Price upon publish date of this article: $14.53
U Beauty Resurfacing Compound Serum
When a skin care formula promises to do eight things at once, eyebrows get raised, but the U Beauty Resurfacing Compound Serum is a beauty product that’s true to its word. During hectic happenings (read: red carpets), all one really wants is simplicity. Given the fact that this multihyphenate serum replaces your toner, Vitamin C and E serums, AHA exfoliant, antioxidant complex, retinol, and hyaluronic acid, it’s simplicity incarnate. Built-in retinol and peptides work to promote a more youthful appearance, while blemishes are reduced and uneven texture is resurfaced thanks to a host of other ingredients. U Beauty’s patented technology takes a nitty-gritty approach, targeting precisely the areas of the face most susceptible to free radicals. In short order, they’re neutralized and glass skin — your glass skin! — is the joyous outcome.
Editor’s testing and review notes: “My dry skin would be a disaster during winter without U Beauty’s Resurfacing Compound. After just a couple of uses, I could see and feel the improvement in my skin’s textures and complexion — a rarity in a heavily saturated skin care market.” — Director of Commerce Adam Mansuroglu
Price upon publish date of this article: $148
Tatcha The Dewy Skin Cream
3,400+ five-star reviews
Never thought you’d sport Japanese purple rice on your face? There’s a first time for everything. This, after all, is the star ingredient of The Dewy Skin Cream from Tatcha — an anti-aging cream that plumps, hydrates, and locks in moisture for the long run. The best part is that only a pearl-sized dollop is required in the morning and night to achieve luminosity. As far as dewy faces are concerned, a little goes a long way.
Editor testing and review notes: “Tatcha’s Dewy Skin Cream is a year-round staple I use when my skin is feeling parched, sensitive, or unbalanced in any way. It has a soft, cooling feel when you apply it, and it layers beautifully over other skin care products and under makeup. When I use it consistently, I notice less redness and more radiance.” — Sullivan
Price upon publish date of this article: $68.40
Biodance Bio-Collagen Real Deep Masks
4,000+ five-star reviews
After amassing millions of rave reviews on TikTok in the past few months, Biodance’s collagen sheet masks have taken a coveted spot on Amazon’s beauty bestseller list. These hydrogel sheet masks are soaked in a solution of hydrating ingredients like hyaluronic acid, as well as skin-brightening niacinamide and allantoin. Apply it onto clean skin and relax — after three to four hours, the white mask will turn clear, signaling that your skin has soaked up all of its radiance-boosting ingredients.
Editor testing and review notes: I’m a side sleeper, so overnight face masks usually aren’t my jam, but Biodance’s adheres so well to my skin that it didn’t disrupt my sleep. In the morning, my skin felt much more hydrated than it typically does with a thick coat of night cream. For the price, this is an excellent sheet mask to have on hand when you want extra beauty rest.” — Sullivan
Price upon publish date of this article: $19
Eos Shea Better Body Lotion
A reliable body lotion is a beauty essential, especially if you’re regularly shaving your legs and catching a lot of sun in the summer. This best-selling vegan lotion from Eos is formulated with luscious shea butter, which infuses rich hydration without feeling heavy on the skin. It promises 24-hour moisture, and comes in a delicious vanilla cashmere fragrance that one WWD Shop editor particularly loved to layer with sweet body sprays in the summer.
Editor testing and review notes: “I have generally tough skin, but for some reason the skin on my legs is especially sensitive. This body lotion caused zero irritation, and I love it as a summer swap for my typically thick winter moisturizers. It glides on and absorbs so smoothly, and even acts as a great base for applying self tanner on top. It’s a great value for the price — I’ve used it for over two months and I still have plenty of product left to enjoy.” — WWD Shop Commerce Writer & Producer Olivia Cigliano
What testers say: “This lotion is incredible! The consistency is a happy medium of thick, but not too thick, and quickly absorbs! I had really dry skin when I was pregnant and postpartum. I was using other lotion plus coconut oil. When I found this lotion, it helped SO much! Dry, flaky skin is gone and I also noticed my skin is a lot softer! The vanilla smells really good! Will be sticking with this lotion for the foreseeable future!”
Price upon publish date of this article: $8.98
Weleda Skin Food Original Ultra-Rich Cream
Weleda Skin Food is one of the richest — and most effective! — moisturizers for dry, sensitive skin that our editors have tested. The cult-favorite face cream is full of plant-based emollients like sunflower seed oil and sweet almond oil, as well as calming chamomile and calendula extracts. This makes it a great choice for treating irritated skin or sealing in moisture in arid environments, say, if you’re going on a ski trip. A little goes a long way with this cream, and you can use it on split ends, hands, and cuticles, too.
Editor testing and review notes: “I’ve used this face cream for years. Every time I stray away from it for a few months to try something new, I inevitably come back to Skin Food for its ability to make my skin look dewy and radiant. Because of its thick, balm-like texture, I make sure that I give any face serums I’m wearing a full minute or two to absorb before I follow up with the cream (otherwise, it takes some elbow grease to blend). Some moisturizers only seem to keep skin supple right after you’ve applied them, but this one makes a difference in my overall skin feel and texture after I wear it for a day. Pro tip: Use it in place of liquid highlighters on your cheeks for a believable touch of dewiness.” — Sullivan
What testers say: “I’ve been really happy with this product’s performance. It hydrates dry skin incredibly well, making it feel soft and revitalized. An added benefit is its versatility, it can be applied anywhere on the body. I would definitely recommend it to anyone struggling with dry skin. It’s truly a game changer!”
Price upon publish date of this article: $14.04
Augustinus Bader The Rich Cream
When Cynthia Erivo of “Wicked” fame says Augustinus Bader’s The Rich Cream is her go-to for dry skin issues, you run to buy Augustinus Bader’s The Rich Cream. It’s really that simple, especially when considering how effective this cell-renewing moisturizer is. Its magic ingredient is something called Trigger Factor Complex, also known as TFC8 (and if it all sounds scientific, that’s the whole point). The brand’s founder is a biomedical scientist and specialist in stem cell biology who concocted a complex of amino acids and vitamins designed to regenerate the skin on a cellular level. Omega-6 fatty acids, antioxidants, and evening primrose oil also play supporting roles here in soothing skin and fighting free radicals. The result is something A-listers and average Joes alike strive for, subsequently functioning as a great equalizer of sorts: a firmer and smoother complexion.
Editor testing and review notes: Augustinus Bader’s The Rich Cream is a worthy skin care investment piece that can take the place of many other products. Our testers noticed immediate and long-term benefits. The cream feels luxurious on your skin and layers well with other skin care and makeup products without pilling.
Price upon publish date of this article: $190
Neutrogena Hydro Boost Hyaluronic Acid Hydrating Water Gel Moisturizer
#5 Amazon Bestseller in Face Moisturizers
It’s rare to find an ultra-hydrating moisturizer that’s lightweight and oil-free at an affordable price point. But Neutrogena does it all with their best-selling water gel. It’s infused with hyaluronic acid which binds with water molecules to draw moisture in the skin. It’s specially formulated for dry skin, but it’s suitable for oily and combination skin too, thanks to its oil-free formulation.
Editor testing and review notes: “This moisturizer gives my skin an instant boost of hydration. It absorbs so quickly and makes for an ideal makeup base in the mornings — and is especially lightweight in hot weather. I love applying it fresh out of the shower after applying a face serum.” — Sullivan
What testers say: “I have combination skin and this moisturizer works so so well. My T-zone is really oily. The rest of my face sometimes gets so dry it flakes, and the moisturizer I was using would then burn (my skin is sensitive). This stuff never burns, at all. It’s sort of gel-like and a little goes a long way so it will last a lot longer than you’d think. I lightly dab one finger in it and it’s enough for my whole face. It leaves my skin so soft and moisturized without making my T-zone oily. Definitely recommend.”
Price upon publish date of this article: $17.95
St. Tropez Self Tan Express Mousse
Kelsea Ballerini was positively shining at the 2025 Grammy Awards, and the cult-favorite St. Tropez Self Tan Express Mousse is to thank for that. Considered one of the very best self-tanners in the industry, the mousse grants a natural, sun-kissed look even during the gloomiest of winter seasons and can be used to achieve three customizable tan depth options based on how long you set it for. Celebrity makeup artist Kelsey Deenihan worked with Ballerini for this year’s Grammys, and she used the St. Tropez Luxe Velvet Applicator Mitt (only $9!) to apply the mousse in circular, even motions. Deenihan let the self-tanner develop on her client’s skin for two hours — after which a quick rinse reveled a bronzed look of medium intensity that still has everyone talking. Psst… St. Tropez recommends exfoliating and moisturizing the skin before application to ensure your tan lasts as long as possible.
What testers say: “As someone with naturally pale skin who struggles to tan, even during the summer, finding a reliable self-tanner has been a game-changer for me. One of the standout features of this self-tanner is the scent. Unlike many other tanners that have an overpowering chemical smell, St. Tropez has a pleasant, subtle fragrance that’s easy on the senses. The application process is a breeze — the formula spreads evenly, dries quickly within minutes, and leaves no sticky residue.”
Price upon publish date of this article: $46
Kate Somerville Exfolikate Intensive Exfoliating Treatment
This clean and green exfoliating treatment from Kate Somerville is one of the Greatest Skin Care Products of All Time, according to WWD, for its nourishing formula that sloughs off dry skin and leaves the complexion naturally radiant. Suitable for all skin types, it features gentle, plant-based exfoliants like papaya, pineapple, and pumpkin enzymes, along with a long list of healthy hydrators including aloe vera, honey, vitamin E, and lactic and salicylic acids that work to brighten dull skin.
Editor testing and review notes: “When my skin gets extra dull and lifeless, this is the first product I reach for. I love that it has a little bit of texture to it (you can feel it working) and that it doesn’t leave my skin feeling stripped.” — Sullivan

- Check for verified sellers: To ensure you’re purchasing from a verified storefront, rather than spending your hard-earned money on counterfeit, expired, or damaged products, double check the seller of the listed product. This is as simple as looking at the “sold by” sections in the product description and making sure it says Amazon or the brand’s name. Another way to tell if a product is safe to buy is by seeing if it is available for Prime Shipping — this is a sign that the brand is an established market partner for Amazon and has been vetted. If a listing has the Amazon’s Choice badge, the item comes from an Amazon-approved seller, too.
- Shop Amazon’s storefronts: Amazon provides influencers and tastemakers (like Alix Earle) platforms to curate their favorite beauty buys with personal Amazon storefronts. - Set deal notifications: Always on the hunt for an Amazon deal? One of the best ways to stay on the pulse of Amazon sales is by opting into alerts. You can do so by creating a Wish List on your account, which will prompt the retailer to send notifications based on the products you’re interested in whenever they’re on sale. To create a Wish List, tap the “Wish List” icon in the app and select “Create a List.” Then, go to “Settings” and then “Notifications,” and make sure the “Deals” option is turned on. If you’re looking for a product that isn’t on your Wish List, you can set up a specific deal alert by going to the Amazon app’s homepage and selecting “Today’s Deals.” From there, search for your desired product and select “Watch This Deal.” You’ll then receive alerts when the price drops on that product.
- Don’t hesitate on a good deal: On top of sales that run during shopping events, Amazon also offers flash deals on popular items. The retailer’s “lightning deals” refer to a limited number of discounts that are offered on a single item for a short period of time. If you spot an item on your wishlist with a steep price drop, it’s best to snag it ASAP, because it could disappear at any moment. To find these deals, go to the Today’s Deals page. Remember that these sales are only available until supplies last or the promotion period for the deal ends, and lightning deals typically have a limit of one purchase per customer.
